Name: Execute AWS Powershell Script
Description: This combines two previous library templates of [checking for Chocolatey being installed](http://library.octopusdeploy.com/#!/step-templates/actiontemplate-chocolatey-ensure-installed), and [installing something via Chocolatey](http://library.octopusdeploy.com/#!/step-templates/actiontemplate-chocolatey-install-package), in this case awstools.powershell, and then adds on a third piece of running a custom Powershell script using AWS Powershell tools
Author: hulahomer

Parameters.Name: SecretKey
Parameters.Label: SecretKey
Parameters.HelpText: Enter your AWS Secret Key here. This will be used to authenticate the session with AWS

Parameters.Name: AccessKey
Parameters.Label: AccessKey
Parameters.HelpText: Enter your AWS Access Key here. This will be used to authenticate the session with AWS

Parameters.Name: Region
Parameters.Label: Region
Parameters.HelpText: Enter the region for where you will be executing your powershell scripts against. If you are unsure of the region you are in, check the list found [here](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/using-regions-availability-zones.html)

Parameters.Name: AWSScript
Parameters.Label: AWSScript
Parameters.HelpText: This is the Powershell Script that contains commands using the AWSPowershell module that you want to execute
